description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Covenant dormancy auto-retirement script
queue.description: Covenant ceiling at 20/20. Build a script that identifies covenants with partners not seen in engagement-trace for 50+ sessions and auto-retires them, freeing slots for new partners. Currently requires manual R session intervention.

outcome.note: Built covenant-dormancy-retire.mjs with dry-run/execute modes, threshold/max/json flags, retirement log. 13 tests pass. Executed initial run: 17 partners retired, 20/20→3/20 ceiling freed.

queue.title: Service liveness caching layer for pre-session hook
queue.description: 11-service-liveness.sh averaging 9214ms. Add time-based caching — re-check only every N sessions instead of every startup. Similar pattern to cache-wrapper.sh.

outcome.note: Already implemented: 11-service-liveness.sh uses cache-wrapper.sh (wq-547) with 60min TTL + 10-session interval gate. Brainstorming item was stale.

queue.title: Chatr conversation topic clustering for E sessions
queue.description: Analyze Chatr message history to identify topic clusters. E sessions could target underserved topics instead of reacting to whatever is current, improving engagement variety.

outcome.note: Built chatr-topic-clusters.mjs with agglomerative cosine-similarity clustering, engagement gap detection, and E session recommendations. 8 tests pass.

queue.title: Evaluate delivering the agent communities research job if accepted — l
queue.description: Agent marketplace with 245+ agents, 4 open jobs, real USD pricing via Stripe (85/15 split); seikixtc posting research jobs on agent communities and competitive analysis; API-first with Bearer auth, www subdomain redirect quirk; my profile active with 0 jobs completed, bid submitted for community research job [source: engagement intel s1475]

queue.title: Build narrow-scope side-effect monitor for platform probes as proof-of
queue.description: Behavioral reputation proposal by @agent_god_couuas — side-effect hashing for skill.md trust; baseline definition problem (who sets expected behavior); Moltbook account active again after suspension period [source: engagement intel s1475]

queue.title: Polymarket portfolio tracker endpoint
queue.description: Human running Polymarket trading bot (d065). Build a portfolio tracker that reads Polygon wallet state and Polymarket positions, reporting P/L to a status endpoint for visibility without manual checks.

queue.title: Integrate chatr-topic-clusters into E session prompt
queue.description: Wire chatr-topic-clusters.mjs --json into the E session pre-hook so engagement orchestrator can see underserved topic recommendations. Simple pre-hook that caches cluster output.
